sailpoint.integration

Class AbstractIntegration

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.integration.AbstractIntegration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IntegrationInterface

    public class AbstractIntegration
extends java.lang.Object
implements IntegrationInterface
    A base implementation of IntegrationInterface that stubs out most methods methods to throw exceptions. This should be extended rather than directly implementing IntegrationInterface to protect from changes to the interface.

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        public void configure(java.util.Map args)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: IntegrationInterface
        Must be called immediately after construction to provide a set of configuration parameters. The source of these parameters is undefined. For RemoteIntegration they will come from an IntegrationConfig. This not an RPC method, it is only used to pass context into the implementation.

        Map keys must be String. Map values may be any Object but are normally String, Integer, List or other Maps.

        Specified by:
        configure in interface IntegrationInterface
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • ping

        public java.lang.String ping()
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: IntegrationInterface
        Return some sort of status message. The format of the status message is undefined, the request is considered successful if the return value is non-null. Connection problems will have been caught at a higher level. If we get here and there is something internally wrong throw an exception with an explanatory error message. When using IIQIntegrationServlet an exception will be converted to a 500 HTTP response.
        Specified by:
        ping in interface IntegrationInterface
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • listRoles

        public java.util.List listRoles()
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: IntegrationInterface
        Return the current list of "manageable" roles. This may be all the roles in the system, or it may be a subset depending on configuration in the system. This list will be compared to the list of "exportable" roles in IIQ to determine which role definitions to send.

        This is primarily used to determine which roles need to be deleted by comparing it with the managed role list in IIQ.

        It could in theory be used to filter the set of roles being sent down but it isn't enough since the role could have been modified since it was last sent. In order to filter roles to send we either need the provisioning system to return the modification date with the name (which not be accurate) or we need to remember the last date of push in IIQ somewhere. The later seems more reliable.

        Specified by:
        listRoles in interface IntegrationInterface
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addRole

        public RequestResult addRole(RoleDefinition def)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: IntegrationInterface
        Create or update the definition of a role.

        Return a RequestResult with the request details or null for a success.

        Since we have a way to return errors, the implementation should use the message array rather than throwing exceptions.

        Specified by:
        addRole in interface IntegrationInterface
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        Description copied from interface: IntegrationInterface
